abstracts.cdata!:
The vision of the Amazon Region
            Protected Areas Project (ARPA) is to create a mosaic of
            protected areas around productive landscapes to maintain the
            ecological integrity of the region over the long term. The
            project aims to add 28 million hectares in new protected
            areas (PAs) in the Brazilian Amazon over the next 10 years,
            while helping to consolidate the existing protected areas
            system. This will result in a total of 50 million hectares
            of Amazon forested ecosystems under protection and
            sustainable use, an area the size of Spain.
